abstract: Brian Frons canceled the soap operas “All My Children” and “One Life to Live.” But the change doesn’t mean the network is rethinking its daytime focus on nonscripted lifestyle and health programming.
snippet: Brian Frons canceled the soap operas “All My Children” and “One Life to Live.” But the change doesn’t mean the network is rethinking its daytime focus on nonscripted lifestyle and health programming.
lead_paragraph: Brian Frons, the ABC executive who angered legions of soap opera fans earlier this year by canceling “All My Children” and “One Life to Live,” will leave the network next month when his contract expires.

headline.main: Head of ABC’s Daytime Programming Is Leaving
